duty.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant is owner of the three-unit building adjacent to the sidewalk (¶2) and specifically alleges she owed a duty to lawful users of the sidewalk to keep it reasonably safe and warn of hazards (¶16), and that she had ability/responsibility to address the hazard (¶10).

breach.reasoning: Complaint alleges specific negligent acts: clearing only a narrow path without de-icing material (¶5, ¶17(a)), allowing that path to refreeze into ice (¶6), and failing to remedy or warn after notice from tenants (¶9, ¶17(b)-(c)).

causation_but_for.reasoning: Plaintiff alleges the ice formed because no de-icing was applied (¶5-6), she slipped on that ice and fell (¶7-8), and that her fall and injuries resulted from that hazardous icy condition (¶11), which pleads that the injury would not have occurred but for the hazardous ice.

causation_proximate.reasoning: The complaint alleges the icy sidewalk was a known/obvious hazard (¶6, ¶9-10), and that slipping and sustaining a back injury are the foreseeable consequences of leaving a public sidewalk icy and unaddressed (¶11, ¶16-17), satisfying proximate causation at pleading stage.

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges specific physical injury (sprained lower back) and related injuries (¶11, ¶19), quantifies medical expenses (~$1,200) (¶12, ¶19) and lost wages (~$800) (¶13, ¶19), and pleads pain, emotional distress, and other damages (¶14, ¶19).
